clinical_study.official_title: COLON MD: Colon Cancer Longitudinal Study of the Microbial Metabolites and Dietary Factors That Influence Response to Treatment

brief_summary.textblock: The goal of this proposal is to identify how the composition of the gut microbiome and diet interact to impact chemotherapy-induced diarrhea incidence and severity.

detailed_description.textblock: In this longitudinal observational study patients will supply samples of their gut microbiome prior to scheduled colonoscopy or surgery along with dietary intake and blood samples; the relative abundance of microbes from those samples along with dietary data will be used to predict the presence or absence and severity of chemotherapy-induced diarrhea. Microbiome and diet based predictions from blinded samples will be combined to map the diet-microbiome changes during treatment to the changes in immune markers and risk of chemotherapy-induced diarrhea.

primary_outcome.measure: Microbiome-Based Prediction of Chemotherapy-induced Diarrhea in Colon Cancer
primary_outcome.description: Microbiome analysis from at least 112 blinded samples will be conducted from fecal samples to determine sensitivity, specificity and accuracy (reported as %) of a microbiome-based predictor of chemotherapy-induced diarrhea in stage II/III colon cancer.

secondary_outcome.measure: Dietary-Based Prediction of Chemotherapy-induced Diarrhea in Colon Cancer
secondary_outcome.description: Dietary analysis from at least 112 blinded surveys will be conducted using food frequency questionnaires (DHQ-III) plus 24 hour recalls collected during treatment to determine sensitivity, specificity and accuracy (reported as %) of a dietary-based predictor of chemotherapy-induced diarrhea in stage II/III colon cancer.

arm_group.description: All patients going on study will be put in the observational grouping for blood and tissue collection with option for stool collection.

biospec_descr.textblock: Stool sample kit, Tissue at time of surgery, blood draw(2 vials) at specific times up to 5 times.

study_pop.textblock: Stage II/III colon cancer patient, prior to surgery

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Stage II/III colon cancer diagnosis
- Age >18 and < or equal to 79.
- Ability to perform informed consent
- FOLFOX treatment expected
Exclusion Criteria:
- Not diagnosed with Stage II/III colon cancer.
- Not Pregnant
- Does not have Lynch syndrome or FAP diagnosis.
- Inability to perform inform consent
- inability to comply with follow up program
- history of prior colon cancer diagnosis
- previous treatment with antibiotics in the last month.
- previous bowel resection.
